website_summaries.verdict: This heavy-duty tripod comes with a carry bag, which makes it easy to transport to your campsite.
pros: Easy to set up and take down
Does not include pot or grill
cons: Legs slide if placed on a hard, flat surface

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be a nice, simple tool to have when cooking over fire with cast iron... But when I got it , it would NOT stand... 2 more people checked it out & they too wondered 😟.... ITS NOT STABLE !!! & with a cast iron pot over a fire ..I thought O'NO... TRIED to Return it But the Company would NOT work with me... I would have to pay $15. to Return it ... The Company business , does bad business 👎
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the $20!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Built with sturdy materials. Holds my 16 quart Dutch oven with ease. The steel legs don't bend at all. I definitely recommend this for anyone into Dutch oven cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Gunsallis

customer_reviews.title: Does an amazing job and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: We have used this tripod probably a dozen times now and LOVE it! It comes with a storage sleeve which keeps the ash and dirt the legs collect from getting all over our car. We use it with a 1-quart cast iron dutch oven, which is perfect for two people and can be seen in the picture below where the tripod is in full-glory. The dutch oven in the picture is this and does NOT come with the tripod: Legs can get VERY hot while in use, but use a stick or your pot lid lifter to remove the tripod from the fire when finished and it cools quickly. We highly recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of weight
customer_reviews.text: I hung 24" cooking grate with a 10' chain and the standard cast iron lodge. The top stayed cool. Looked like new after first use. I got a smaller charcoal grate for the next camping trip. Must clean and season the charcoal grate before use and treat it like cast iron afterwards. Also, I put some grill mats and had some pre-cooked pizza at about 6K ft altitude. Everything came out delicious. Make sure to position it correctly (see youtube videos) before adding the chains. Tip: I placed the cast iron on the fire to warm it up before adding food to it.
customer_reviews.author: C. c.

customer_reviews.title: Too Short with Fire Ring
customer_reviews.text: Two things about this tripod I'm not happy about. 1). It is to short if you are using a fire ring. It does not allow you to really adjust the high you dutch oven is over the fire as the legs are to short. 2). It can be a little unstable which is a bit unnerving when pulling hot beef stew off the fire. I'm sure over a campfire that is on the ground this is not an issue. But if you have to go around a fire ring with any height, you will be using the S hook at it's highest level and still be.to close and hot. Hope this is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Tiny product, false advertising
customer_reviews.text: The product listing on Amazon says this is 48 inches high, weighs 13 pounds, and the image shows it being used with a large cast iron pot. Unfortunately, it's all false advertising, and in a very blatant sense. It's 43 inches tall, not heavy duty (very flimsy), and would never come close to fitting a large Dutch oven. The most you could do with this would be to melt butter, and even then, you'd better have a tiny fire. It pretty much epitomizes capitalism; cheap and laden with broken promises. Anyone seriously planning on cooking over a fire would be far, far better served getting something much taller and sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Some people say it’s not worth it because it is weak. No it’s not weak!! it will hold heavy pot (not sure how heavy it was but it was heavy really heavy with food). Worth to try it for the money, it work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Beata

customer_reviews.title: campfire cooking made easy
customer_reviews.text: I love cooking over an open fire when we go camping and this tripod allows me to do that without having to worry about the metal getting too hot. I have used other ones that are able to be folded up, but the strings catch on fire and then they are no good....no strings here to catch on fire. It comes with a bag that you can put it back into for storage. I purchased some chain and set ours up to hold a round rack so we can cook just about anything that we want over the fire. Just remove the rack and use the hook to hold a pot if your making soup or stew.
customer_reviews.author: Resa Wickings

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you're cooking over a small fire with a small pot.
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this and ordering a taller one. After you spread the legs out there is very little room for height adjustment. Especially if you have a large pot. I have a 8qt dutch oven, which takes up much of the usable vertical adjustment. If you have a wider fire ring that requires you to spread the legs out further you lose almost all of your room for adjustment. At some point you might as well put the pot right in the fire.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Yes held up to my expectations . Smoked to whole chicken breast and two pork shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Spuds3

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: This product worked like a charm. You do need to set it up to give maximum distance between legs and therefore maximum stability. I took my heavy cast iron pot, chained it to the tripod and outdoor made my own cranberry sauce. Besides being fun, I saved on the heat in the house, and added a wonderful smell to the backyard for Christmas Day!
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Cowie

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with the missing chain, so by the time we unpacked it while camping it was pretty much useless. I did not purchase a “used” one either..
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Works great for campgrounds and park cooking
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! It's much shorter than others offered but I didn't have the room to carry or store the long poles and I wanted the sturdiness of solid legs. This was tall enough to hang over a camp fire ring. I added 4 smaller chains with S-hooks and hung a grill rack and made hot dogs. It's nice to have the option of the dutchie or a flat surface for cooking. I wanted my own cook surface as the public fire rings are just so gross with old cooked grease from previous tenants.
customer_reviews.author: SCB

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: It's not tall enough for a campfire pit, I should have read the reviews as it's too short for the pot to be placed over the fire properly. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Used one received
customer_reviews.text: WOW! RECEIVED A USED ONE....NOT IMPRESSED WITH EXPERIENCE OR PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: El W

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy.
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to set up. I tried to set up without pushing the feet into the dirt and couldn't get the legs to lock in right. Once I pushed them into the dirt the rings settled soon as I put a pot on the hook. It does sit low but I like that as it should only be hung over a small fire that has burned to mostly coals anyway. So far it seems to be working as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Tripod hold the Pot
customer_reviews.text: A simple design, makes this an easy tripod to set up and tear down. The metal and chain are sturdy and capable of holding a large pot full of food. I have used this tripod once now, and it worked flawlessly. The fact it came in it's own nylon case is a definite plus. This is a shorter tripod than some of the others out there, so you may need to dig a pit for your fire depending on what you make.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite tripod.
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great.... but the way this item is connected make its so difficult to set up and use. Had nothing but trouble with this the whole time we were camping. I have used two other style tripods that were more functional. It does do its job... we cooked with it about 8 times. But I do not care for the way the rods are linked together. I would have returned it if I hadn't used it already!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty legs and chain, a no nonsense cooking tripod.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty steel legs and large gauge chain easily support a full cast iron Dutch oven. A hook at the top of legs and the chain makes adjusting the pot height easy. Comes with a cloth carrying bag. Legs are not adjustable but of course collapse together from the top pivot. This would be a bit long for backpacking with, but otherwise it's fantastic at a good price. I didn't want adjustable legs so this was perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: JasonTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: works great. I bought this along with a new dutch ...
customer_reviews.text: works great. I bought this along with a new dutch oven to take camping this year. I'm going to be doing a lot more campfire cooking from now on
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with the 5qt pot, this tripod is perfect for my cooking needs. I would have liked to have found one a bit taller, perhaps 5 feet but I was unable too, this size seems to be the common height (unless I make one), the chain of course can be adjusted to raise or lower the pots height, so in the end this one will very much make do! Love it, worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Ours came 36" tall....not what we expected.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2-45" tall cooking stands and received 2-36"....where does one build a fire under such a low tripod??
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Halloween to hold a cauldron. Its very sturdy and solid. Definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Albert Cropek

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but I wish it was bigger.
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent product that does its job well, but it'd be nice if the legs were several inches longer so they can straddle a larger fie. Thy're so short that they really do need to be rather close together to get enough height for the pot to be suspended above the fire. The chain also has to be set very short as otherwise the pot will nearly be sitting on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kepler

customer_reviews.title: Was little tricky to set up , but worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: Giving 5 stars because at the end the soup came out super good! Legs for my fire pit are too short(but it was my fault, I should do more research to see how tall the tripod is). First, I was little confused how to put those legs, so it does not fall.The top with the hook is kind a confusing, but either way you put it ,under the weight of iron dutch oven it will not fall( at least mine did not).
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Not as broad a spread between legs as you'd think
customer_reviews.text: Met my needs, but I should have bought a set with more length for better hanging height variation. I suspect that the cast iron pot used in the illustration is a small sized pot compared to what most car-campers use for stews, soups, cobblers, etc. Comes with a nice carrying bag for folding up and storing when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Reinke

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and inexpensive: a winning combination.
customer_reviews.text: This camping tripod is sturdy and strong enough to support a reasonably heavy cast iron pot of anything you can fit between its legs. If you are going to set on something other than soil, you might consider connecting the ends of the three legs together to prevent them from sliding apart, which is what happened to me when I tried to set it on a concrete slab.
customer_reviews.author: asimov

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Super easy set up- strongly held up very heavy Dutch oven. Height adjustable. Just what we need and great bargain .
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Galey

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I've used this on about 5 camping and it has held up great. Very sturdy and durable. Nice quality. Just wish it wasn't so dang heavy. So I wouldn't mind carrying it in my backpack. Pros 1.) Very strong 2.) Great coating on legs Cons 1.) Little heavy to carry backpacking 2.) Doesn't work well with pots that don't have bail handles. As you can see from my pictures I modified it to work with my pot.
customer_reviews.author: HouserOutdoorsTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Not as long as it looks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tripod to use with a 12 quart cast iron Dutch oven. It was too short. The picture must be with a 3 quart Dutch oven. Also the included bag was too short for the tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Chiriboga

customer_reviews.title: NOT Cast iron as advertized
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost the reason I picked this product was due to the short life of the thin metal poles on units i owned and i knew Cast iron would last much longer.THIS PRODUCT IS NOT CAST IRON AS ADVERTIZED IN AMAZON. Being disabled it is a hassle to return, I've had 3 returns this year and feel bad for AMAZON so I will keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Suggested purchase with my dutch oven, glad I did pick it up. It was definitely used. Very sturdy design.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.text: First, this does not come with a cauldron. It is not very sturdy either. If you even touch it, it falls over. I had to use sand bags to keep it from falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Simple
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father who is in the Buckeye Dutch Oven Society. He said it was simple to use, transport, and store. He also said that it worked beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Love

customer_reviews.title: Comined this with patio fire pit.
customer_reviews.text: This is very well made. I bought a dish shaped patio fire pit from Home Depot and made three brackets to hold the three legs on the rim of the fire pit disc. I also lined the steel firepit with foundry fire bricks and I now have a super cook center with my dutch oven.
customer_reviews.author: S. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I recently had the opportunity to use this on a camping trip over Thanksgiving weekend. The shipping was timely, and the tripod worked as expected. The Tripod and chain was sturdy and held the weight of my 12 quart dutch oven and its contents.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Nice Medium Height Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy steel assembly, just wish the legs were a little longer. My fault for not thinking about how tall they should be in relation to the fire underneath. I realize the chain allows for adjusting the height of the dutch oven but some tripods I have seen in the past had longer legs and would work better for hanging a wire grill to cook meats on. I can't wait to go camping and give it a workout.
customer_reviews.author: JeT

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice for outside only thing I thought would of came with bottoms so it will stand on its own with out putting it in the ground other then that it’s ok
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Gill

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, price is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Incredible thickness, very well made. Is an excellent prop for our Halloween decorations.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Bought to hold a cauldron for Halloween yard decorating. Fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is so perfect!!! NOT made cheaply! Holds my heavy cast iron pot with ease, and was able to add another chain to hold a round grate. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Melonie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome unit. Recommend seasoning after each use for easier cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, usability, and size. Can cook 2 whole chickens at once.
customer_reviews.author: Product user

customer_reviews.title: Nice tripod
customer_reviews.text: Tripod is well made, just a little challenging to stabilize sometimes. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Host

customer_reviews.title: Whoever developed these hasn’t cooked over a campfire
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting a tripod that could hold a Dutch oven off a decent size fire by atleast a foot and a half. This device holds a dutch oven 16 inches off the ground so you better have a small fire.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the camping gear
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to the camping kit this year. I used it both with a dutch oven, and with a tea kettle, and it worked well. It came with a durable denim case, although the threads were kind of "jut twine" like for the closure. I will replace them one of these days. The chain is long enough to go all the way to the ground giving great flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: DragoDellAqua

customer_reviews.title: The tripod supports its weight.
customer_reviews.text: Stansport Cast Iron Cooking tripod comes in its own carrying bag. that was pretty handy. It seems unstable but is really plenty strong. Set up the tripod and chain length before you add your dutch oven. Mine had a different handle than the one shown. We made due by looping the chain around the handle and connecting the hook to a chain link. I may find a better solution next year when we camp. Overall it works perfectly and I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wickstrom

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: I wish these were longer to fit over elevated fire pits.
customer_reviews.author: SteelersFamily

customer_reviews.title: Could stand to be about 6" taller
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy and works well to hold our Dutch Oven, but it's a touch short for standard size fire pits. The legs could stand to be about 6 inches longer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cook

customer_reviews.title: Dutch oven companion
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camp cooking or a stew in the backyard. Heavy duty i expect it will last my lifetime
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Not tall enough
customer_reviews.text: First off this is made of 3/8 round stock..the chain is ample long....It's just not tall enough in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Short
customer_reviews.text: Advertising was correct, but reality is this is too short to use. Needs to be 2 feet longer. My fault for not being more careful
customer_reviews.author: lem

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. Not an easy thing to use but he lives it
customer_reviews.author: Cara Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Portable Camp Fire Tripod
customer_reviews.text: The camp fire tripod is sturdy with no assembly. I did not realize it came with travel bag. I plan to use it mostly for decoration in my fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is good and looks like it will last. But the way the junction of the 3 rods is designed takes some maneuvering to adjust into place. A tiny metal ring with all 3 rods threaded through it would have worked a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Glas

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Cooked over a camp fire a fews times with this, using a cast iron dutch oven. functions as intended. Hang height can be adjusted by looping the s hook up or down a few links. I don't cook with Dutch ovens often though so probably won't get much use.
customer_reviews.author: Delivered Apr 7, 2016 - Apr 12, 2016

customer_reviews.title: excellent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the price. Sturdy & worked perfectly using it in my firepit for an antique griddle and a large #12 lodge camp oven .
customer_reviews.author: James Owens

customer_reviews.title: A must for a campfire.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve use this 15 times since I purchased it. By far the sturdiest tripod I have and easy to maneuver and it will hold a number 12 deep Dutch oven for stew without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Gipe

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy cast iron legs and sturdy chain
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy cast iron legs and sturdy chain. I went to the hardware store and bought a 16inch grill grate, some S hooks and small chain and hung the grate. You will have no problem with these legs, they do not fold or collapse so dont expect them to. I didnt need anything that folded and this purchase was exactly what I was looking for. Again, extremely heavy construction and this will last for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I typically do not write reviews, but this is an exceptional cooking tripod. I do recommend this. Works perfectly for my cast iron pots. Came with an awesome black sleeve/case for storage. Good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Durable for Camping
customer_reviews.text: Withheld several cookings over the open fire and the material was quite durable. Good idea for a camping trip
customer_reviews.author: JustTalkingShep

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: Great for our scouts. They really enjoy outdoor cooking on campouts.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Zwick

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Came unassembled and was very difficult to get the pieces into the triangular puzzle like head. Is very thin and unimpressive. Did come with a nice carrying sleeve which would have been better if it had a strap. You get what you pay for. It arrived in lightning fast time. Looks very lightweight and will do the job for very light weight use.
customer_reviews.author: Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Quality, nice carry case
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy material, just have to get used to configuring it to support weight properly
customer_reviews.author: Matt Orosz

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality looks great, can’t wait until summer so we can use it
customer_reviews.author: JULIE REYNOLDS

customer_reviews.title: Versatile. Great for parties and camping.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, awesome for parties. Can be hard to remove from tripod when hot. Need plenty of potholders or a welding glove actually works better. Can be used without the tripod, which can be easier. The lid flips over and makes a nice cooking surface.
customer_reviews.author: BraggDAAE

customer_reviews.title: Scam alert
customer_reviews.text: All that came is a steel tripod. No cast iron pot as in the ad. Complete rip off. Pure scam.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's 100% with some modification
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty sturdy but can't give it 5 stars. It was too short and the chain was a pain to adjust. I built some legal extentions and modified the chain. Now it's exactly what we need and still fits in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL G SPINDLER

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Kind of hard to get in in the right position but once you do it is very sturdy. Could use a diagram on how to lock it in place.
customer_reviews.author: pick

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my wife for her birthday. She loved it. Sure, I make the cobblers when we camp but she lives it all the more.
customer_reviews.author: Neil C.

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose, very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Held a good sized Dutch Oven for a few hours. It was a little finicky to get stood up with the hook hanging the right way, but once we got it figured out, it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Using a stable, cooking tripod using a heavy-duty, ...
customer_reviews.text: Using a stable, cooking tripod using a heavy-duty, Lodge, 4-quart pot requires a substantial tripod for saftety reasons; this tripod insures even cooking and satisfies my high, safety requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Would like to see stronger "S" hooks.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure that supplied "S" hooks will support the weight of a 5 quart dutch oven when full???
customer_reviews.author: Michael W

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Sturdy Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tripod. My one complaint is that the chain wasn't longer to help go through a two-handled pot, but I bought a chain at Lowe's which worked fine. The tripod is sturdy and heavy metal. It was shorter than I anticipated, so make sure you want this size (I didn't really review the measurements before I bought it).
customer_reviews.author: Nicola Martina

customer_reviews.text: Nicely built. Sturdy and priced right. It's only drawback is that it is sometimes hard to set up, but once you get it positioned correctly, it is solid.
customer_reviews.author: LynusAnn

customer_reviews.title: Handy product
customer_reviews.text: Used it camping last October. It was shorter than I expected, but actually held our cast iron pot perfectly over the fire. Didn't burn or warp in any way. Definitely a good purchase. We used it for 3 nights straight. It's also compact and easy to travel with it's own little case.
customer_reviews.author: D.K.A.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy, sturdy item that sets up easily in a firepit or on it's own. One problem we had was the chain and S-Hooks were missing when it arrived. Since we were going camping the following day and needed it, we decided to buy the missing items rather than return it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased and fed
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased to know I will have this to pass on & the experience & tradition to my kids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: used this over a camp fire with a cast iron pot, worked well.
customer_reviews.author: jones3907

customer_reviews.title: Try again
customer_reviews.text: the stand is to short for placing over a camp fire and the legs are hard to lock into place. it continously fell over once a pot was placed o it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Griffin

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: We use this with our 8 qt Dutch Oven over our outdoor fire-pit and it works AWESOME! Very heavy duty for the price. It would hold a much larger cauldron if you had one. Better than expected for the $! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin rods
customer_reviews.text: The tripod legs are about 3/8ths rods. Not as thick as you would thing tripod legs should be. This tripod might not hold a large Dutch oven and could warp in the high heat of a fire.
customer_reviews.author: BPCRST

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy and a big awkward to set straight ...
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsy and a big awkward to set straight. But, it does seem to hold the Cast Iron Potjie Pot we purchased to go with it, well. Packing was secure.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than I would have liked, but good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The tripod rods are shorter than I would like, but it works and is a good enough for the money
customer_reviews.author: NO1UNO

customer_reviews.title: great product good price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty heavy duty. I used it with a cast iron. 8 QT Dutch oven with a solar cooker. Held up great. I think it would be great over a campfire too. The legs will splay out if used on a hard smooth surface like a driveway but held great on my hunting property which is mostly limestone bedrock.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: This is built to last
customer_reviews.text: Looked at many other tripods but a lot of them were of questionable quality. These are truly cast iron and will last you a life time as long as you take care of them. The storage bag is a huge plus so that you can store it nicely without losing the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Overlander

customer_reviews.title: 3 rods should not be so confusing to lean up ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 rods should not be so confusing to lean up against one another but the chain throws a kink into the plan.... It could be redesigned with asupport sleeve to slide over the top to keep the Tee Pee in place
customer_reviews.author: brad isom

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for campfire cooking
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The best thing to use to cook in campfire
customer_reviews.author: Marianna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this so many times already. Easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Anas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as shown! Purchased for camping, would not hesitate to purchase again, especially at the price point!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not as nice as it looks in the picture.
customer_reviews.text: The legs are flimsier than they appeared in the picture. They also tend to splay unless you drive them into the ground a little or block them from sliding with rocks. Ended up not using it because it just seemed too flimsy for a heavy cast iron dutch oven full of liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Gabbard

customer_reviews.title: This worked out great for us
customer_reviews.text: This worked out great for us, we even made additional attachments for it. It's a much more durable material than what you find at the larger stores and the price is reasonable
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea L

customer_reviews.title: Not Cast Iron. Is advertised as cast iron but ...
customer_reviews.text: Not Cast Iron. Is advertised as cast iron but when the package came it had a small sticker over the cast iron typing that said steel construction.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie R

customer_reviews.title: Good quality solid steel tripod
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod! Amazing for the price! Be sure to read the description, it is not constructed from cast iron as the name may suggest. It is solid steel. Comes with the chain and hook, and a carrying bag. All good quality. Would recommmed.
customer_reviews.author: Meara

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my witches cauldron and it's great for camping too!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really tall enough for most campfires in AZ state ...
customer_reviews.text: Not really tall enough for most campfires in AZ state parks. Can be difficult to use but very handy when you have the right fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Meshugga

customer_reviews.title: Worthless. Not tall enough to stand high enough above ...
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. Not tall enough to stand high enough above nor be positioned above any normal campfire I have ever built.
customer_reviews.author: SoNotRacer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with the cast iron dutch oven that I gave to my mother in law. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Not tall enough for use. The bottom legs will ...
customer_reviews.text: Not tall enough for use . The bottom legs will sink into the soil if it is soft, so you will need to place something under each leg to stop this from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Mims

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: My opinion it’s the best way to cook when using a Dutch oven , it’s pretty sturdy and easy to use when you can get the placement right , I recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and a simple & easy design make this a must have for those who like to enjoy something other than rations or granola while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

product_meta.title: Stansport Cast Iron Camping Tripod for Outdoor Campfire Cooking
feature_bullets: Sturdy three leg design for stability
Holds Dutch ovens, coffee pots, tea pots, etc
Works well to hang lanterns, water Jugs, and clothing
Lead free, Heavy duty solid steel construction, Nickel plated chain with "S" hook for easy cooking height adjustment
Perfect for hanging Dutch ovens, tea pots, coffee pots ect. over a cooking fire
Also can be used for lanterns, water jugs, and drying clothes
Safe easy set up and storage
